articles.title: No More Needles: Stanford Scientists Create a Painless, Living Vaccine You Rub on Your Skin - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Stanford scientists discovered that a harmless skin bacterium triggers a powerful immune response. By tweaking a bacterial protein, they turned it into a living vaccine, training the immune system to fight diseases like tetanus and diphtheria. Mice given this…
articles.content:
Findings in mice by Stanford University scientists could translate into a radical, needle-free vaccination approach that would also eliminate reactions including fever, swelling, and pain.
Stanford … [+11225 chars]
